page.title: 13HISTORY, LICKEY
page.content: {Famous families and people The{Cadbury}family owned a lot of the Lickey Hills but sold it to B'ham City Council to be preserved as a recreation area. The{Windsor}family of Hewell Grange owned much of the land in Lickey and the surrounding area.The monument was erected in 1834 for Other Archer Windsor.Harriet,Baroness Windsor ordered the building of the school and Holy Trinity Church. { {The Earl of Plymouth}sold land for building, on condition that each house would have half an acre of garden. {Lord Austin}, founder of the car company, lived in Lickey and is buried at Holy Trinity Church. {F.A.Millichip},the chairman of the Football Association,lives in Twatling Road. He has been involved
